The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. 2,600mm (100in) Length 3,995mm (157.3in) Width 1,821mm (71.7in) Height 1,617mm (63.7in) Kerbweight 1,362kg (3,003lb) The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by the Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra , based on the X100 platform of Mahindra XUV300 . It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Overview [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications [ edit ] The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants [ edit ] The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. {'url': 'https://www.carblogindia.com/mahindra-xuv3xos-safety-rating-ncap/', 'content': 'What is Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating at NCAP? Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Overview [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications [ edit ] The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants [ edit ] The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. Mahindra XUV300, 3XO sales cross 335,000 units, up 80% in FY2025 The XUV 3XO, which is the refreshed XUV300, has given a new charge to this compact SUVs sales. Not only are its sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 up 80% YoY and already its highest in a fiscal but with February-March 2025 numbers yet to be pencilled in, the XUV 3XO will hit 100,000 units in FY2025. In the process, this models sales since launch on February 14, 2019, will also surpass 350,000 units. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12984 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. Published On Nov 04, 2024 12:07:00 PM 10,013 Views Follow us on Recently launched Thar Roxx among Mahindra's popular models. By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra recorded its highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units in October, up from 51,062 units in the previous month. The companys year-to-date performance remains strong, with total SUV sales reaching 3,14,714 units, representing a 22 percent growth compared to the previous twelve months. Mahindra exported 3,506 units in October XUV 3XO sales average 9,000-10,000 units a month Mahindra's performance was highlighted by strong demand across its SUV portfolio during the festive season. Some of its models, such as the Thar Roxx, have been doing exceptionally well. The demand for the Roxx crossed 1.76 lakh units within an hour of its bookings opening. Deliveries for the Thar Roxx have commenced in phases, and some buyers have a delivery timeline as late as May 2026 . In addition to the domestic SUV sales, Mahindras export figures stood at 3,506 units, marking an 89 percent increase compared to the previous year. Another popular model from Mahindra, the XUV 3XO, saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. The waiting period for the Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue rival is as high as six months for some variants. report_sections.heading: Executive Summary
report_sections.content: The SUV segment has experienced significant growth globally, driven by consumer preferences for spaciousness, safety, and versatility. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a key player in the compact SUV market, particularly in India, offering a blend of performance, luxury, and safety features. This report provides an overview of the global SUV market, a detailed analysis of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and its sales performance in the Indian market. report_sections.heading: Global SUV Market Analysis
report_sections.content: The global SUV market is characterized by rapid growth, driven by evolving consumer preferences and technological advancements. Key trends include the increasing adoption of electric and hybrid SUVs, the rising popularity of compact and subcompact SUVs, and the integration of advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS).  The SUV market dominates global car sales, accounting for nearly 50% of total vehicle sales in major markets such as the U.S., Europe, and China. Automakers are expanding their SUV lineups, introducing compact, mid-size, luxury, and electric SUVs to cater to diverse consumer needs. Compact SUV sales rose 12%, electric SUV sales jumped 81%, and compact models like Chevrolet Trax saw 130% growth in 2023.

bullet_points: Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity
Electric SUV sales are rapidly increasing
ADAS integration is becoming a standard feature
SUVs account for nearly 50% of global car sales

report_sections.heading: Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV designed to offer a blend of style, performance, and features. It is available with both petrol and diesel engine options, and features a range of luxury and safety enhancements. The XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, a 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and a 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof.  With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides an overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including its design, specifications, and key features.
bullet_points: Available with petrol and diesel engine options
Features a spacious boot and panoramic sunroof
Offers over 60 connected car features
Equipped with Level 2 ADAS

report_sections.heading: Luxury Features and Interior Design
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury features designed to enhance comfort and convenience. These include premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and passive keyless entry. The car also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. The XUV 3XO cabin provides a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. It comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system and a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation.  With the ADRENOX Connect technology, drivers can control the car's features through a smartphone.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section provides a detailed analysis of the luxury features and interior design of the Mahindra XUV 3XO.
bullet_points: Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch materials
Cooled glovebox with illumination
Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system
ADRENOX Connect technology for smartphone control

report_sections.heading: Safety Features and ADAS
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO is equipped with a comprehensive suite of safety features, including ABS, ESC, and multiple airbags. It has also achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. The XUV 3XO offers Level 2 ADAS with features such as forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, and lane departure warning.  The XUV 3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17 in Adult Occupant Protection (AOP). The vehicle scored 43 out of 49 points in the Child Occupant Protection.
report_sections.descriptive_text: This section highlights the safety features and ADAS technologies in the Mahindra XUV 3XO.
bullet_points: 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP
ABS and ESC for enhanced stability
Level 2 ADAS with multiple driver-assistance features
High scores in adult and child occupant protection

report_sections.heading: Indian Market Sales Analysis and Trends
report_sections.content: The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance in the Indian market. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, and Mahindra XUV 3XO achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. In February 2025, Mahindra's XUV300 and 3XO sales crossed 335,000 units, up 80% year on year for the fiscal year 2025.  The Mahindra XUV 3XO saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. October 2024 was the highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units.

\n

SUV Market Analysis Report

\n
\n Executive Summary\n Market Analysis\n XUV 3XO Overview\n Luxury Features\n Safety Features\n Indian Sales\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n

Executive Summary

\n

The SUV segment has experienced significant growth globally, driven by consumer preferences for spaciousness, safety, and versatility. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a key player in the compact SUV market, particularly in India, offering a blend of performance, luxury, and safety features. This report provides an overview of the global SUV market, a detailed analysis of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and its sales performance in the Indian market. The global SUV market is projected to reach USD 166.05 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 15.30% from USD 53.16 billion in 2024. The increasing demand for electric and hybrid SUVs is a key trend driving this growth. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has been shown to achieve solid sales, contributing significantly to Mahindra's overall SUV sales volume.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Global SUV market projected to reach USD 166.05 billion by 2032
    • \n
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a significant player in the compact SUV segment in India
    • \n
  • Electric and hybrid SUVs are key growth drivers
    • \n
  • Mahindra's focus on safety and luxury features enhances market appeal
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n
\n
\n\n
\n

Global SUV Market Analysis

\n

The global SUV market is characterized by rapid growth, driven by evolving consumer preferences and technological advancements. Key trends include the increasing adoption of electric and hybrid SUVs, the rising popularity of compact and subcompact SUVs, and the integration of advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS). The SUV market dominates global car sales, accounting for nearly 50% of total vehicle sales in major markets such as the U.S., Europe, and China. Automakers are expanding their SUV lineups, introducing compact, mid-size, luxury, and electric SUVs to cater to diverse consumer needs. Compact SUV sales rose 12%, electric SUV sales jumped 81%, and compact models like Chevrolet Trax saw 130% growth in 2023.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity
    • \n
  • Electric SUV sales are rapidly increasing
    • \n
  • ADAS integration is becoming a standard feature
    • \n
  • SUVs account for nearly 50% of global car sales
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n
\n
\n\n
\n

Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV designed to offer a blend of style, performance, and features. It is available with both petrol and diesel engine options, and features a range of luxury and safety enhancements. The XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, a 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and a 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Available with petrol and diesel engine options
    • \n
  • Features a spacious boot and panoramic sunroof
    • \n
  • Offers over 60 connected car features
    • \n
  • Equipped with Level 2 ADAS
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Engine TypeMax PowerMax Torque
1.2L Turbo Petrol110 PS200 Nm
1.2L TGDi Turbo Petrol130 PS230 Nm
1.5L Diesel117 PS300 Nm
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

Luxury Features and Interior Design

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury features designed to enhance comfort and convenience. These include premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and passive keyless entry. The car also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. The XUV 3XO cabin provides a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. It comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system and a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation. With the ADRENOX Connect technology, drivers can control the car's features through a smartphone.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch materials
    • \n
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination
    • \n
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system
    • \n
  • ADRENOX Connect technology for smartphone control
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
FeatureDescription
Touchscreen10.25-inch high-definition display
Audio SystemHarman Kardon 7-speaker system
ConnectivityADRENOX Connect technology
Voice ControlBuilt-in Amazon Alexa
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

Safety Features and ADAS

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is equipped with a comprehensive suite of safety features, including ABS, ESC, and multiple airbags. It has also achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. The XUV 3XO offers Level 2 ADAS with features such as forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, and lane departure warning. The XUV 3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17 in Adult Occupant Protection (AOP). The vehicle scored 43 out of 49 points in the Child Occupant Protection.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP
    • \n
  • ABS and ESC for enhanced stability
    • \n
  • Level 2 ADAS with multiple driver-assistance features
    • \n
  • High scores in adult and child occupant protection
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n

Forward Collision WarningAlerts driver of potential collisions
Adaptive Cruise ControlMaintains a safe distance from the vehicle ahead
Lane Departure WarningAlerts driver if the vehicle drifts out of its lane
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

Indian Market Sales Analysis and Trends

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance in the Indian market. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, and Mahindra XUV 3XO achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. In February 2025, Mahindra's XUV300 and 3XO sales crossed 335,000 units, up 80% year on year for the fiscal year 2025. The Mahindra XUV 3XO saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. October 2024 was the highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Achieved 79,208 units in the past 12 months
    • \n
  • XUV300 and 3XO sales are up 80% year on year for fiscal year 2025
    • \n
  • Average monthly sales range between 9,000 and 10,000 units
    • \n
  • October 2024 recorded highest-ever monthly SUV sales
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n
\n
\n
\n\n

nodes.description: Retrieve data on the overall SUV segment market size and growth trends globally.
nodes.agent_prompt: Find data on the overall SUV market size (in USD) and growth trends (CAGR) globally for the past 5 years. Include projections for the next 5 years. Provide sources.

output.initial_thoughts: I need to find data on the SUV market size, growth trends, and future projections. I will use the search_web_with_text_content tool to gather this information. I will use multiple search queries to ensure I capture a comprehensive view of the market.

code.CODE_1:

code.CODE_2:

output = {'market_data': results}
code.CODE_3:

output = {'market_data': results}

nodes.description: Retrieve data on SUV sales trends globally, including top-selling models and regional variations.
nodes.agent_prompt: Find data on SUV sales trends globally, including the top-selling models in each region (North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific). Include specific sales figures and market share percentages. Provide sources.

output.initial_thoughts: Okay, I need to find data on SUV sales trends globally, including top-selling models in each region, sales figures, and market share percentages. I'll use `search_web_with_text_content` to gather this information. Since the query is quite broad, I'll use multiple search queries to cover different aspects and regions. I will provide sources for the data.

code.CODE_1:
results = search_web_with_text_content('SUV sales trends global market share 2024', 8)
output = {'global_suv_trends': results}
code.CODE_2:
results = search_web_with_text_content('top selling SUV models North America sales figures market share', 6)
output = {'north_america_suv': results}
code.CODE_3:
results = search_web_with_text_content('top selling SUV models Europe sales figures market share', 6)
output = {'europe_suv': results}
code.CODE_4:
results = search_web_with_text_content('top selling SUV models Asia Pacific sales figures market share', 6)
output = {'asia_pacific_suv': results}

output.code_audit: I have reviewed the code to ensure it uses the `search_web_with_text_content` tool correctly with different search queries covering global SUV trends and regional top-selling models. The code includes multiple code blocks to address different regions, increasing the chances of obtaining the necessary information. The code is syntactically correct and covers all aspects of the query.

nodes.agent_prompt: Find detailed information on the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including its engine specifications, performance metrics (acceleration, fuel efficiency), dimensions, and unique selling points. Provide sources.

nodes.description: Retrieve data on the luxury features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, including interior design, technology, and comfort elements.

output.initial_thoughts: Let me think through this. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. 2,600mm (100in) Length 3,995mm (157.3in) Width 1,821mm (71.7in) Height 1,617mm (63.7in) Kerbweight 1,362kg (3,003lb) The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by the Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra , based on the X100 platform of Mahindra XUV300 . It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Overview [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications [ edit ] The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants [ edit ] The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. 2,600mm (100in) Length 3,995mm (157.3in) Width 1,821mm (71.7in) Height 1,617mm (63.7in) Kerbweight 1,362kg (3,003lb) The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by the Indian automaker Mahindra & Mahindra , based on the X100 platform of Mahindra XUV300 . It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Overview [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications [ edit ] The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants [ edit ] The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Overview [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications [ edit ] The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants [ edit ] The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. {'url': 'https://www.carblogindia.com/mahindra-xuv3xos-safety-rating-ncap/', 'content': 'What is Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating at NCAP? Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. It has been sold in the Indian market since 29 April 2024,in mid of 2024 was also went to sale in South Africa and followed in Australia from July 2025. XUV 3XO is the facelift of the Mahindra XUV300 . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] Overview [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO was introduced in April 2024 as a facelift of XUV300 model. The XUV 3XO comes with enhanced engine options, a refreshed design, and new technology features aimed at catering to the needs of both urban and off-road drivers. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] Specifications [ edit ] The XUV 3XO has a seating capacity for 5 passengers and a boot space of 364 litres. It has a 42 litres (11USgal) fuel tank, and a mini spare wheel. It has a McPherson strut front suspension with an anti-roll bar, and a torsion beam suspension with coil springs in the rear. Its turning radius is 5.3 metres (17ft). Variants [ edit ] The XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants: [ 8 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] MX Series: Includes MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, and MX3 Pro. AX Series: Includes AX5, AX5 Luxury, AX7, and AX7 Luxury variants. REVEX Series: Includes REVX M, REVX M(O), and REVX A. The top-end variant, AX7 Luxury, features a panoramic sunroof, advanced infotainment options, and a full suite of safety features including ADAS . In Australia, only the AX5L and AX7L variants, all with the Petrol 1.2L TCMPFi engine, are available. Powertrain [ edit ] The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with three engine options, two 1.2 L turbocharged petrol three-cylinders or a 1.5 L turbodiesel four-cylinder. [ 11 ] [ 12 ] [ 13 ] The base engine is a port-injected version of the petrol three-cylinder which produces 82kW (111PS; 110hp) and 200Nm (20.4kgm; 148lbft) of torque. The diesel engine has common rail direct injection and produces 85.8kW (116.7PS; 115.1hp) and 300Nm (30.6kgm; 221lbft) of torque. The direct injected and intercooled petrol engine is only available on higher grades, and outputs 96kW (131PS; 129hp) and 230Nm (23.5kgm; 170lbft) of torque. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. Mahindra XUV300, 3XO sales cross 335,000 units, up 80% in FY2025 The XUV 3XO, which is the refreshed XUV300, has given a new charge to this compact SUVs sales. Not only are its sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 up 80% YoY and already its highest in a fiscal but with February-March 2025 numbers yet to be pencilled in, the XUV 3XO will hit 100,000 units in FY2025. In the process, this models sales since launch on February 14, 2019, will also surpass 350,000 units. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12984 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. 54,504 units in October 2024 Homegrown SUV maker is seeing rising demand thanks to popular models like the Thar Roxx and XUV 3XO, among others. Published On Nov 04, 2024 12:07:00 PM 10,013 Views Follow us on Recently launched Thar Roxx among Mahindra's popular models. By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra recorded its highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units in October, up from 51,062 units in the previous month. The companys year-to-date performance remains strong, with total SUV sales reaching 3,14,714 units, representing a 22 percent growth compared to the previous twelve months. Mahindra exported 3,506 units in October XUV 3XO sales average 9,000-10,000 units a month Mahindra's performance was highlighted by strong demand across its SUV portfolio during the festive season. Some of its models, such as the Thar Roxx, have been doing exceptionally well. The demand for the Roxx crossed 1.76 lakh units within an hour of its bookings opening. Deliveries for the Thar Roxx have commenced in phases, and some buyers have a delivery timeline as late as May 2026 . In addition to the domestic SUV sales, Mahindras export figures stood at 3,506 units, marking an 89 percent increase compared to the previous year. Another popular model from Mahindra, the XUV 3XO, saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. The waiting period for the Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue rival is as high as six months for some variants. Mahindra XUV300, 3XO sales cross 335,000 units, up 80% in FY2025 The XUV 3XO, which is the refreshed XUV300, has given a new charge to this compact SUVs sales. Not only are its sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 up 80% YoY and already its highest in a fiscal but with February-March 2025 numbers yet to be pencilled in, the XUV 3XO will hit 100,000 units in FY2025. In the process, this models sales since launch on February 14, 2019, will also surpass 350,000 units. By Ajit Dalvi 14 Feb 2025 12984 Views Share - The Mahindra XUV300, reborn in a new avatar in April 2024 as the XUV 3XO , turns six years old today. Launched on February 14 and Valentines Day in 2019, the popular compact SUV has, till end-January 2025, has sold a total of 335,017 units. Thanks to the XUV 3XO, this compact Mahindra SUVs growth trajectory is currently at its best yet since launch, having sold 85,990 units, up 80% YoY (April 2023-January 2024: 47,672 units). The launch of the XUV 3XO (above right) in April 2024 has accelerated sales. The 85,990 units sold in the first 10 months of FY2025 are up 80% YoY. At this pace, the 3XO will go on to hit the 100,000-units sales mark in FY2025. Not only are the XUV 3XOs sales in the first 10 months of FY2025 already the highest in a fiscal, having beaten the previous best of 60,968 units of FY2023, but with February-March 2025 sales yet to be pencilled in, they are set to hit the 100,000 sales mark in FY2025. In the process, this models cumulative sales since launch will also surpass 350,000 units. Whats amply clear is that the rollout of the XUV 3XO in end-April 2024 has accelerated sales. Year-on-year, M&M has sold an additional 38,318 units. This compact SUV is currently the second best-selling Mahindra SUV after the Scorpio twins (137,311 units). That the XUV300 would become another Mahindra high-selling SUV was seen soon after launch seven years ago the company received 13,000 bookings in the first 28 days . The Mahindra compact SUV went on to hit 200,000 sales in May 2023 , 47 months after launch. The 300,000 milestone came up 16 months later in early October 2024. Given the current rapid pace of sales, the 400,000 sales milestone should be achieved in even fewer months. At present, the 3XO is 65,747 units away from that big number and should hit it around August-September 2025. What is helping accelerate sales for this SUV is the gains coming from M&Ms heightened focus on safety. In mid-November 2024, the XUV 3XO, along with the Thar Roxx and XUV400, aced the Bharat NCAP crash test . These models have now joined Mahindras growing portfolio of five-star-rated vehicles, which includes the XUV700 and Scorpio-N. 3X0 AS A SALES ACCELERATOR TO MAHINDRAS STELLAR GROWTH In FY2024, with 54,726 units, the XUV300 contributed 12% to the companys dealer dispatches and was among the prime movers that powered M&M to its best-ever fiscal year sales of 459,877 units and also among Indias Top 20 best-selling utility vehicles in FY2024 . Last fiscal, the XUV300 was the fifth high-selling Mahindra SUV model in FY2024 after the Scorpio, Bolero, XUV700 and the Thar. 54,504 units in October 2024 Homegrown SUV maker is seeing rising demand thanks to popular models like the Thar Roxx and XUV 3XO, among others. Published On Nov 04, 2024 12:07:00 PM 10,013 Views Follow us on Recently launched Thar Roxx among Mahindra's popular models. By Akbar Merchant Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra recorded its highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units in October, up from 51,062 units in the previous month. The companys year-to-date performance remains strong, with total SUV sales reaching 3,14,714 units, representing a 22 percent growth compared to the previous twelve months. Mahindra exported 3,506 units in October XUV 3XO sales average 9,000-10,000 units a month Mahindra's performance was highlighted by strong demand across its SUV portfolio during the festive season. Some of its models, such as the Thar Roxx, have been doing exceptionally well. The demand for the Roxx crossed 1.76 lakh units within an hour of its bookings opening. Deliveries for the Thar Roxx have commenced in phases, and some buyers have a delivery timeline as late as May 2026 . In addition to the domestic SUV sales, Mahindras export figures stood at 3,506 units, marking an 89 percent increase compared to the previous year. Another popular model from Mahindra, the XUV 3XO, saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. The waiting period for the Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue rival is as high as six months for some variants. SUV Market Analysis Report

\n
\n Executive Summary\n Market Analysis\n XUV 3XO Overview\n Luxury Features\n Safety Features\n Indian Sales\n
\n
\n
\n
\n\n
\n
\n

Executive Summary

\n

The SUV segment has experienced significant growth globally, driven by consumer preferences for spaciousness, safety, and versatility. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a key player in the compact SUV market, particularly in India, offering a blend of performance, luxury, and safety features. This report provides an overview of the global SUV market, a detailed analysis of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and its sales performance in the Indian market. The global SUV market is projected to reach USD 166.05 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 15.30% from USD 53.16 billion in 2024. The increasing demand for electric and hybrid SUVs is a key trend driving this growth. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has been shown to achieve solid sales, contributing significantly to Mahindra's overall SUV sales volume.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Global SUV market projected to reach USD 166.05 billion by 2032
    • \n
  • Mahindra XUV 3XO is a significant player in the compact SUV segment in India
    • \n
  • Electric and hybrid SUVs are key growth drivers
    • \n
  • Mahindra's focus on safety and luxury features enhances market appeal
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n
\n
\n\n
\n

Global SUV Market Analysis

\n

The global SUV market is characterized by rapid growth, driven by evolving consumer preferences and technological advancements. Key trends include the increasing adoption of electric and hybrid SUVs, the rising popularity of compact and subcompact SUVs, and the integration of advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS). The SUV market dominates global car sales, accounting for nearly 50% of total vehicle sales in major markets such as the U.S., Europe, and China. Automakers are expanding their SUV lineups, introducing compact, mid-size, luxury, and electric SUVs to cater to diverse consumer needs. Compact SUV sales rose 12%, electric SUV sales jumped 81%, and compact models like Chevrolet Trax saw 130% growth in 2023.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Compact and subcompact SUVs are gaining popularity
    • \n
  • Electric SUV sales are rapidly increasing
    • \n
  • ADAS integration is becoming a standard feature
    • \n
  • SUVs account for nearly 50% of global car sales
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n
\n
\n\n
\n

Mahindra XUV 3XO Overview

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV designed to offer a blend of style, performance, and features. It is available with both petrol and diesel engine options, and features a range of luxury and safety enhancements. The XUV 3XO offers multiple engine options, including a 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, a 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and a 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Available with petrol and diesel engine options
    • \n
  • Features a spacious boot and panoramic sunroof
    • \n
  • Offers over 60 connected car features
    • \n
  • Equipped with Level 2 ADAS
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Engine TypeMax PowerMax Torque
1.2L Turbo Petrol110 PS200 Nm
1.2L TGDi Turbo Petrol130 PS230 Nm
1.5L Diesel117 PS300 Nm
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

Luxury Features and Interior Design

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a range of luxury features designed to enhance comfort and convenience. These include premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and passive keyless entry. The car also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. The XUV 3XO cabin provides a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. It comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system and a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation. With the ADRENOX Connect technology, drivers can control the car's features through a smartphone.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • Premium leatherette seats and soft-touch materials
    • \n
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination
    • \n
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system
    • \n
  • ADRENOX Connect technology for smartphone control
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
FeatureDescription
Touchscreen10.25-inch high-definition display
Audio SystemHarman Kardon 7-speaker system
ConnectivityADRENOX Connect technology
Voice ControlBuilt-in Amazon Alexa
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

Safety Features and ADAS

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is equipped with a comprehensive suite of safety features, including ABS, ESC, and multiple airbags. It has also achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests. The XUV 3XO offers Level 2 ADAS with features such as forward collision warning, adaptive cruise control, and lane departure warning. The XUV 3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17 in Adult Occupant Protection (AOP). The vehicle scored 43 out of 49 points in the Child Occupant Protection.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

\n
    \n
  • 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP
    • \n
  • ABS and ESC for enhanced stability
    • \n
  • Level 2 ADAS with multiple driver-assistance features
    • \n
  • High scores in adult and child occupant protection
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
FeatureDescription
Forward Collision WarningAlerts driver of potential collisions
Adaptive Cruise ControlMaintains a safe distance from the vehicle ahead
Lane Departure WarningAlerts driver if the vehicle drifts out of its lane
\n
\n
\n\n
\n

Indian Market Sales Analysis and Trends

\n

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has demonstrated strong sales performance in the Indian market. In June 2025, the total sales figure of XUV 3XO was 7,089 units, and Mahindra XUV 3XO achieved a sales milestone of 79,208 units in the Indian market over the past 12 months. In February 2025, Mahindra's XUV300 and 3XO sales crossed 335,000 units, up 80% year on year for the fiscal year 2025. The Mahindra XUV 3XO saw average monthly sales in the range of 9,000-10,000 units. October 2024 was the highest-ever monthly SUV sales of 54,504 units.

\n
\n

Key Insights:

    • \n

    • \n
  • Average monthly sales range between 9,000 and 10,000 units
    • \n
  • October 2024 recorded highest-ever monthly SUV sales
    • \n
\n
\n
\n \n
\n
\n
\n\n
